      • IsBestSolution

        public static boolean IsBestSolution(double[] C)
        Check if the current solution is the best one, by checking if coefficients in C are negative.
        Parameters:
        C - is the objective function coefficients vector, with the explicit term in last position.
        Returns:
        true if C contains the best solution, false otherwise

      • CopyMat

        public static void CopyMat(double[][] src,
           double[][] dst)
        Copies one matrix to another one
        Parameters:
        src - source matrix
        dst - destination matrix. dst dimensions must be the same as src

      • PivotTo

        public static double[] PivotTo(double[][] A,
               double[] B,
               double[] newB,
               int i,
               int j,
               int target,
               int py)
        Transform the element at (i, j) in A to the value of target, by calculating a transform factor to multiply the i-th line with.
        Parameters:
        A - is the constraints coefficients matrix
        B - is the explicit terms vector
        newB - is the resultant explicit terms vector after PivotTo() execution
        i - index of the row in A
        j - index of the column in A
        target - value that the element in (i, j) in A must be transformed to
        py - row of exitting variable
        Returns:
        double[] - the transformed row in A

      • GaussJordan

        public static void GaussJordan(double[][] A,
               double[] B,
               int i,
               int j)
        Performs a Gauss-Jordan reduction using the element in A at index (i, j) as pivot.
        Parameters:
        A - is the constraints coefficients matrix
        B - is the explicit terms vector
        i - index of the row in A (line of exitting variable)
        j - index of the column in A (column of entering variable)

      • FindEnteringVar

        public static int FindEnteringVar(double[] C)
        Finds the next variable to enter base.
        Parameters:
        C - is the objective function coefficients vector, with the explicit term in last position.
        Returns:
        int the index of the column corresponding to the entering variable.

      • IsColumnNegative

        public static boolean IsColumnNegative(double[][] A,
                       int i)
        Parameters:
        A - is the constraints coefficients matrix
        i - is the index of the column to check
        Returns:
        true if all the elements of the i-th column in the matrix A are negative.

      • FindExittingVarLine

        public static int FindExittingVarLine(double[][] A,
                      double[] B,
                      int entering)
        Finds the line where GJ reduction must be applied.
        Parameters:
        A - is the constraints coefficients matrix
        B - is the explicit terms vector
        entering - is the index of the entering variable, returned by FindEnteringVar(double[] C)
        Returns:
        int the index of the row in the A matrix, which is the line where Gauss-Jordan reduction has to be applied.

      • IsBase

        public static boolean IsBase(double[][] A,
             int i)
        Check if a variable is a base variable, by checking if the corresponding column in the constraints matrix is an identity column.
        Parameters:
        A - is the constraints coefficients matrix.
        i - is the variable (column in the matrix) to check.
        Returns:
        true if the variable at the i-th column is in base, false oterwhise.

      • GetBaseRow

        public static int GetBaseRow(double[][] A,
             int i)
        Given a base column, returns the line of A corresponding to the base variable
        Parameters:
        A - is the constraints coefficients matrix.
        i - is the index of the base (identity) column
        Returns:
        the index of the row in A corresponding to the base variable

      • GenerateSolution

        public static void GenerateSolution(double[][] A,
                    double[] B,
                    double[] C)
        Generate new coefficents for the objective functions from the updated constraints matrix.
        Parameters:
        A - is the constraints coefficients matrix.
        B - is the explicit terms vector.
        C - is the objective function coefficients vector, with the explicit term in last position.

      • FindNewSolution

        public static void FindNewSolution(double[][] A,
                   double[] B,
                   double[] C)
        Finds a new objective function by swapping base variables, and performing a Gauss-Jordan reduction on constraints matrix.
        Parameters:
        A - is the constraints coefficients matrix.
        B - is the explicit terms vector.
        C - is the objective function coefficients vector, with the explicit term in last position.

      • Simplex

        public static void Simplex(double[][] A,
           double[] B,
           double[] C)
        Perform Simplex algorithm until the best solution is found.
        Parameters:
        A - is the constraints coefficients matrix.
        B - is the explicit terms vector.
        C - is the objective function coefficients vector, with the explicit term in last position.

        public static void PrintMatrix(double[][] A,
               double[] B)
